issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body: The suggested patch applicable to all the main branches: trunk, branch-2, branch-0.23.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12552686/HADOOP-9016.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-tools/hadoop-archives.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Thanks for the patch [~iveselovsky]

+1 (non-binding)
lgtm

Ivan, I feel that fixing a bug in HarFileSystem is outside the scope of this JIRA and would be best to address it separately so that it can get the full attention it needs. In my mind there should only be changes to test code for this JIRA to be completed successfully. If you agree, please file a separate JIRA for the issues in HarFileSystem.

Hi, Jonathan, 
Splitting the patch is difficult because the 2 patches would change the same files and would be dependent on each other.
I converted this Jira to bug, changed the title and description. Now it is positioned as a bugfix + tests to check the fix.
Thanks for fixing up the title and type for the JIRA. I'm +1 on these changes.
